Question: You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving at the same speed
Keep driving at the same speed and flash the vehicle’s headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Slow down and move to the right-hand side of the road

Question: You must NOT open the door of your motor vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: you are parked within 10 metres of a bus stop
you are likely to scratch the paint of your vehicle
the car radio in your vehicle is playing loud music
you are likely to hurt any person

Question: The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: Directions from a police officer overrule traffic signals, road signs and give way rules at an intersection.
Which one of the following vehicles can you drive on a car licence?
What colour is the line painted on a sealed road at a Give Way sign?
What do these road markings mean?

Answers.Answer: Turning vehicles should enter turning lane at arrows and avoid striped area
Turning vehicles should avoid all road markings and use the left-hand lane
All vehicles can make a U-turn at these road markings
Turning vehicles drive straight over all road markings and wait to turn right

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
A warrant of fitness is to show:

Answers.Answer: the year the vehicle was made
if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Question: You should check that there is space for your vehicle on the other side of the crossing before going over a railway level crossing.
What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: If you are under 20, which statement is correct?

Answers.Answer: You are not permitted to drink any alcohol before driving
You may drink two standard glasses of alcohol
You may drink one standard glass of alcohol
There are no restrictions on limits of alcohol but you are not able to drive if intoxicated

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
In addition to checking it is safe to move out from the kerb into the traffic flow, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Accelerate quickly into the traffic flow
Move slowly into a space in the traffic flow

Question: A vehicle should not send out visible smoke for more than how many seconds?
What must you do when you see blue and red flashing lights behind you?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Slow down and drive on carefully

Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?
You are driving on a road with marked lanes and you are in the lane with an arrow showing a left turn only. What must you do?
Can medication from your doctor affect your driving?
What is the recommended distance you should allow when driving past a cyclist?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the maximum distance a load may overhang your vehicle behind the rear axle?
What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?
At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: You must NOT park on the right-hand side of the road, except when:
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When must you pull over and allow an ambulance or fire engine to pass?

Answers.Answer: When it is operating its siren or flashing lights
When it is turning right and you have the right of way

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top right corner of the windscreen

Question: What must you do when red lights are flashing at a railway level crossing?

Answers.Answer: Drive over the lines as soon as the train has passed
Slow down and then drive over the lines
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Stop and if no train is coming you may drive over the lines

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.
